solution_line_template: Ellianna cooking {num_fish_each_type} herrings with {herring_fat_oz} oz of fat each gives her {num_fish_each_type}*{herring_fat_oz} = <<{num_fish_each_type}*{herring_fat_oz}={herring_total_fat}>>{herring_total_fat} oz of fat.

If Ellianna also cooked {num_fish_each_type} eels with {eel_fat_oz} oz of fat each, she got {num_fish_each_type}*{eel_fat_oz} = <<{num_fish_each_type}*{eel_fat_oz}={eel_total_fat}>>{eel_total_fat} 0z of fat.

All the herrings and eels together have a total fat content of {herring_total_fat}+{eel_total_fat} = <<{herring_total_fat}+{eel_total_fat}={herring_eel_combined_fat}>>{herring_eel_combined_fat} oz of fat.
A pike, with {pike_more_than_eel} more oz of fat than an eel, has {pike_more_than_eel}+{eel_fat_oz} = <<{pike_more_than_eel}+{eel_fat_oz}={pike_fat_oz}>>{pike_fat_oz} oz of fat
Cooking {num_fish_each_type} pikes gives {num_fish_each_type}*{pike_fat_oz}= <<{num_fish_each_type}*{pike_fat_oz}={pike_total_fat}>>{pike_total_fat} oz of fat.

Since Ellianna cooked all the fish, she had {pike_total_fat}+{herring_eel_combined_fat} = <<{pike_total_fat}+{herring_eel_combined_fat}={total_fat_served}>>{total_fat_served} oz of fat in her serving.
